results.title: The Soviet Union: epic land
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog, Novosti Press Agency, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Arnold Michaelis
results.brief_description: A survey of the Soviet Union revealing its immense size, diverse geographical features and great range of ethnic groups, from the Uzbeks in their agricultural setting to residents of the city of Moscow at their recreations. Songs and instrumental music native to the areas shown are heard throughout the film.

results.title: The Soviet Union: a student's life
results.brief_description: Looks at the structure of Soviet education, including early schooling, vocational schools, rigidity and difficulty of higher education. Explains the social and recreational life of students as well as the importance of school-state relationship.

results.title: The Soviet schoolchild
results.creator_credit: Soviet War Film Agency, Moscow Central News Reel Studios and Ministry of Information
results.brief_description: Soviet education from nursery schools to technical institutes and universities, showing the subjects taught and the methods of teaching at each type of school. The schools shown are situated in many different parts of the USSR.

results.title: The Southern portion
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Bayside reflections: Port Phillip Bay on film”.
Part one of a most comprehensive and fascinating two part history of Port Phillip Bay, dating back from the 1880’s to present times and incorporating archival footage, both professional and amateur, to cover over a century of settlement in Port Phillip Bay. In particular, focus is on the two main southern peninsulas of Mornington and Bellarine, including Queenscliff, Point Lonsdale, Geelong, Portsea, Sorrento, Mornington and Frankston. The program is divided into seven segments and covers many topics including paddle steamers, fishing, boating, maritime disasters and dramatic rescues, lighthouses, filmmaking, storytelling, environmental issues and the people and architecture of the time. Composed entirely of original film and uses newsreels, documentaries, tourism promotions, advertisements, home movies, dramatic features and short subjects. Commentary by Paul Higgins.

results.title: The Southern Cloud
results.creator_credit: Cleve Maher and Lions Club of Cooma
results.brief_description: Briefly covers the arrival of Charles Kingsford-Smith and C.T.P. Ulm in Australia after their trans-Pacific flight and the formation of the original Australian National Airways that commenced services in 1931. The Southern Cloud was lost in 1931 until its wreckage was discovered in 1958. Narration by James Dibble.

results.title: The Sorcerer's apprentice (K)
results.brief_description: This is the classic Grimm’s fairytale brought to life by the narration of Vincent Price. This colourful animation tells of Spellbinder the Sorcerer who hires Hans as his apprentice, believing that Hans can neither read nor write. Hans is at first an enthusiastic apprentice, but after learning of Spellbinder’s evil ways, plans to use what he has read in the Book of Magic to defeat his master.
